2023 Ladies and Gentlemen Sickle cell disease
is an inherited blood disorder that
impairs the body's ability to properly transport oxygen to tissues.
Sufferers become physically weak and at risk.
risk of premature death. The
US Food and Drug Administration (FDA) on December 8
approved two gene therapies both to treat
sickle cell disease, one of
which is based on gene editing technology
Cris Tuong Thang taught.  The
first therapy, called CV, is
based on crisper technology. It
uses molecular scissors to cut out defective parts of genes
that can then be disabled
or replaced with new normal DNA sequences.  the
second therapy is lipia
this therapy is designed to work
by introducing modified genes into the
body through neutralized viruses these
two therapies are approved for
people 12 years of age and older  and will be
widely available from early next year in
separate clinical trials. Both
treatments help reduce
pain in patients, but the FDA also
warns that these therapies can
cause side effects.  and is tracking
why a species of giant clam that was on the brink of extinction
suddenly
reappeared in large numbers in the waters off
Crosa. The government here has
funded research activities.  conservation of
this species these nobilis pin mussels also
known as noble pen mussels were
found near the northern istrian coast
of ctia a church believed to have discovered
a population of these giant mussels
Last year, from the beginning of the year until now,
biologists have continued to collect
another 100 mussels and brought them to the
aquarium in Paula City to nurture them
before releasing them back into the wild.
Pina nobilis mussels are a species of mussel.  Largest in the
Mediterranean, when mature, it can grow up
to 1.2 meters long. This type of mussel plays an important role
in the marine ecosystem because it can
purify ocean water and provide a
healthy living environment for
creatures.  Since 2016, the number of mussels
began to decline sharply after being infected with
parasites. There were times when they could only count 10,
so scientists once classified them as near-extinct. The

ladies and gentlemen after more than 3 days of searching.  This
morning, the authorities of Ha
Tinh province arrested two prisoners who escaped from
a prison in the province,
Phan Cong Thanh and Nguyen
Dac Hoang. The two prisoners were arrested at
1:45 a.m.  On December 9, while
hiding in Cam Lac commune, Cam Xuyen district,
Ha Tinh province, the military force
used many professional measures combined
with information from the people. Since then, it has been determined that
these two subjects have not left the country.
Cam Xuyen should have been zoned for arrest.
However, due to the complex terrain where the
subjects were hiding, bordering many communes, the
arrest work encountered many difficulties.

subjects serving 19-year and
20-year prison sentences for

Although more than 40 students in Quang Ngai were
hospitalized for suspected food poisoning
after eating fruit jelly,
representatives of the provincial authorities have worked
with relevant people to investigate the
cause according to the law.  Initial news yesterday afternoon,
many students of
Tran Van Tra Primary and Secondary School, Tinh Long commune,
Hoang Ngai city, were fed
fruit jelly by a woman standing outside the school gate
about 5 minutes after eating.
They all appeared.  The current symptoms are abdominal pain and
vomiting. The school quickly took the
children to the Long province commune health station for emergency treatment,
then these cases were transferred to the Obstetrics and
Pediatrics Hospital of Quang Ngai province until
now the children's health is in good health.  I
have been stabilized. The authorities of
Quang Ngai province have worked with the person who distributed
fruit jelly to students to verify
that this woman residing in Tinh Long commune,
Trang Hai city, is a product marketing staff. The

in a restaurant along the
Ho Chi Minh City Trung Luong Expressway section passing
through Chau Thanh district, Tien Giang province
around 9:20 am.  People heard the explosion and
saw fire and smoke rising from the kitchen
in a restaurant near the temple. The fire
burned into the house and the walls were made of
corrugated iron, so people helped put out the fire
and reported for help.  The
Fire Prevention and
Rescue Police Department of Tien Giang province promptly
arrived at the scene to spray water to
fight the fire. The fire did not cause any
human damage, but some property in
the shop was also damaged.  According to people at
the scene, in the morning of the same day, they
saw a gas carrier deliver
two gas cylinders to the restaurant. This restaurant only
operates at night. Currently, the cause of the Viet incident is being
further investigated by the authorities.
